summary: Watch TV shows, movies, and stream Live TV channels without a subscription!

scraped_reviews.content: Plex lifetime member. I like this app a lot on pretty much every other platform besides Android TV. The interface is very outdated and worse Samsung TV, Roku, android phone. some minor annoyances like The skip intro/credit cues are occasionally in wrong spots with no way of adjusting it. forcing subtitles format doesn't always force my subtitle format. subtitle button on my remote didn't work (does for 1/2ish Android TV apps). needs option for skip "previously on"

The ad said this was a free streaming app and that there was no subscription required to watch your favorite movies and TV shows. Yeah, they were telling the truth, but if you don't have a current subscription with Disney+ or other services, you can't watch anything on this app. This app is pretty much useless because if you have a subscription with any other app, you don't need Plex. I would rate the app five stars if they actually had the movies and shows and forced you to watch ads.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: With Plex, users in almost any country can access a large catalog of ad-supported movies and TV shows for you to enjoy free, without purchase. For more information, please view our https://support.plex.tv/articles/categories/video-on-demand/ and https://support.plex.tv/articles/categories/free-live-tv-streaming/ support articles.

scraped_reviews.content: I do not care about Live TV, On Demand, or Discover. I use Plex ONLY to watch my personal movie and TV library. I paid for a lifetime Plex Pass so I could support Plex without all the extra garbage. At the very least, Plex Pass users should be able to disable the Live TV, On Demand, and Discover buttons on the navigation bar. Also give me the ability to separate my movies & TV shows! This new layout is horrific.

New app has outright broken functionality and is a massive step down in reliability and features from the old one. No ability to automatically download latest X number of unwatched shows. No details when looking at anything in the "what's on later" for live TV. No ability to filter media by rating. The progress bar doesn't work for downloaded content. Downloaded content doesn't play when available, it attempts to stream first, and you have to go into downloads to find it. And on and on.

11-14-25 I find that the Android app is, ing gneral, a lot easier to use now. Downloads 'work' but only if you dont want subtitles. Image style subs don't work at all. 6-23-25 The PC and Console apps are really good. Smooth and Easy to use. The Android app is somewhat less easy to use. Still it works quite well.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with us. It helps us to continue to improve our products. Thanks for using Plex!

scraped_reviews.content: They made this app so much more difficult to find your playlists. The playlists used to be a separate item you could choose independent of the libraries! Now you have to go to a library that has content in a playlist to find the playlists with that content! WAY more work than is necessary. And having "Recommended" be the default view instead of "Browse" is BS.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Sorry for the trouble you are experiencing with our app. We welcome any specific feedback you may be able to share with our technical team at https://forums.plex.tv/.

scraped_reviews.content: Unusable slow, crashes all the time. I've been using Plex for years but ever since they rolled out this updated app, nothing works properly. Attempting to access live TV just spins indefinitely, the user interface even when it works for content on your server is incredibly slow to respond, and many welcome prompts are cut off the edge of the screen.

I still like plex but they updated the app and removed a whole lot of functionality, and I find that very annoying. Will update if it ever shows up again. Plex is the best way to keep my library of movies, recorded tv, and music with me all the time. Never have to worry about a streaming service removing something, because it's mine. the app also doesn't work well. it doesn't even play back downloaded videos smoothly. do better, plex.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We‚Äôre sorry to hear that you're not having a great experience with Plex. Please let us know what issues you ran into at https://support.plex.tv/. We're trying to improve the app quality, and your advice would be very useful. Thank you!

scraped_reviews.content: I have had lifetime for over 10 years and I can safely say this is currently the WORST Plex has ever been. After searching online as to why I can't find "manage library access" on the app, I found that it just doesn't exist anymore. What's really fun is how your support documents still reference outdated information that doesn't work anymore. Then I started reading into all the other issues these latest updates have caused with refusal to rollback. Time to switch to Emby/Jellyfin.

This app has turned into a total waste of time, so many issues: cant set the bandwidth you want to stream at as standard, so have to select it EVERYTIME you start watching something that wouldn't be an option, but it doesn't stream well when using normal settings, even if my Internet bandwidth is more than capable (as proven by *checks notes* every other streaming service I use working fine) its now not loading any libraries i am connected to (the ones that I can see on PC version). rubbish
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We‚Äôre sorry to hear that you are having trouble with Plex. If you still have issues, please post specific details in our support forums at https://forums.plex.tv/ if you haven't done so already. Our staff or friendly community should be able to help you out.

scraped_reviews.content: I get that free streaming apps rely on ads to survive, but when ads start in the middle of a sentence of dialog, you have to say enough. I am going to struggle through what I am watching and then uninstall the app. It's actually a shame because there is some good content available. It's just not worth the mid sentence interruptions. Don't waste the space on your device. Very disappointed.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for taking the time to share your feedback with us. The free content on our platform is made possible by the presence of ad-supported streaming. We will look into the frequency and take action as is appropriate.

scraped_reviews.content: Horribly disappointing UX on Android TV. Customization is basically null. "Other Videos" library displayed inexplicably as movies in Library view, which means all the video file names are truncated since everything is movie poster size. Doesn't happen when viewing same library in web app. Basically unnavigable. When i first began using plex over a decade ago, I loved it for its customizability and ease of use. Now, it's just.. buggy.

This new refresh sucks and is unreliable. It's not easy for me to find my servers and half the time they don't even show up anymore even on lan. The android app constantly crashes at start and I have to force close it in the app settings. Come on Plex I've been around since pretty much the beginning and the app was way more user friendly and reliable up until this ui refresh.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We‚Äôre sorry to hear that you are not having a great experience with Plex. We appreciate your feedback and continue to work on improving our products.

scraped_reviews.content: Free streaming, many options! The negative reviews here are utterly nonsensical. For my needs, this is a free alternative to cable with a massive library of movies and series available on demand as well as streaming TV. Is this the best thing ever? Well no. I would make some different choices, and I'd love to run the programming on some of their channels so they are more viewer friendly. e.g. They show the same two episodes of The Office like 3 times a day.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with us. It helps us to continue to improve our products. Thanks for using Plex!

scraped_reviews.content: every time you pause and hit play, it crashes. if you put it as a PIP on top of other apps and open it back up, all of the controls go away. most of the time when you select any movie or show, it will say not found and you have to go back and try again. the option to have the resolution "convert automatically" was removed. it was buggy before, but now it's near unusable unless you never, ever hit pause or rewind. Just hit go on a playlist and never stop.

I was a huge fan, but the app has become a total train wreck. They keep adding new features but breaking or removing old ones. Now the download function no longer works for entire shows, and you can't specify how many episodes to download. The server keeps disabling remote access, playback quality controls are gone, you can no longer manage sync from the server, and server settings are gone from the client. It's a complete disaster. New features are great, but working ones are better.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We‚Äôre sorry to hear that you are having trouble with Plex. If you still have issues, please post specific details in our support forums at https://forums.plex.tv/ if you haven't done so already. Our staff or friendly community should be able to help you out.

scraped_reviews.content: Recent app update has introduced menu options for things like On-Demand, Live TV, and Discover.... None of these options can be disabled or hidden. Not great when you're trying to ensure children only have access to the content that you've vetted. Not to mention, I don't want to use those options myself. Update: previous issue with server access has been resolved.

A year ago it ran like a dream. Now it's laggy and disconnects a lot. Going backwards with each upgrade. Edit: from 2 starts down to 1. Just utter dross. Rare for it to work without needing multiple force stops and usually crashes part way through content. Sort it out! Edit: after the recent upgrade, it keeps asking me to pay for services I've paid for in the past and won't let me continue. Dreadful.

I've been a user of Plex for the last ten years, and the company has been forcing bad change after bad change for the past several years. With the recent removal of music and pictures from Plex and charging for non-local access to my own content, I can no longer recommend Plex over other options. This was such a a good service, once. It is such a a shame to see what it turned into.

The Android TV app, in particular, is nearly unusable. Navigating through content? Not without stuttering. Want to watch an episode? Not without backing out several times to try to convince it to connect. Change playback settings? Not without a crash or three. Casting won't work without much coaxing, and the cherry on top is when it boots me back to a show's episode list within ten minutes of the end of the episode.

For a platform as mature as Plex, you'd expect them to at least put out something that performs better than an early alpha build. Sure, the new refresh LOOKS good. but what's the point if it's not even usable? INCREDIBLY slow, can't play anything without constant stuttering and freezing, features removed. This was not ready for primetime, and the Plex team should revert all changes until they can get their act together.

I HATE that they separated music to another app, completely defeating the whole purpose. the point was to have everything in one place. Now television streaming is all up front and prioritized, and your library comes last under MORE. THIS SUCKS. used to love it... now looking around. initially... Used for years. Bought lifetime subscription on sale. Love it.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Music will be coming back into the Plex apps! We recognized that it was not the ideal choice and we've started with bringing it to our TV apps and then will be bringing it back to mobile devices as well. Thank you for being a member of the Plex Community.

scraped_reviews.content: This app allows me to connect to my home media server and access my movies and tv shows in high quality from anywhere. There have been zero issues with the app, there is a learning curve to get everything setup but plenty of resources to figure it out. Update: well now I can only access my own content on my phone if I pay for it. update 2: now they updated the U.I. of the app, I can no longer make Playlists it's a pain to scroll through since you can't quickly jump to a specific letter.

Since no official support options exist, we must avail ourselves of the tried-and-true "post bad reviews" option, I guess! The Android Plex client UI is fine but streaming is largely busted. Performance on the same LAN as a client is OK but simply doesn't work when accessing over the internet. The same setup works on Windows. iOS, and other platforms. Would love to see this get addressed.

I have used plex for almost 10 years, and the latest update has killed the app. It doesn't open after profile selection, it just spins and spins. I have tried it on my phone (Note10+) and my wife's (Note10+) and it is the same on both. The app for my Amazon Fire tablet works fine. but this version doesn't do anything. I am deeply disappointed.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We‚Äôre sorry to hear that you are having trouble with Plex. If you still have issues, please post specific details in our support forums at https://forums.plex.tv/ if you haven't done so already. Our staff or friendly community should be able to help you out.

scraped_reviews.content: It has a large variety of shows. I was interested in all the older UFC fights that are listed in their channel guide. Unfortunately, you can't watch most of them. I did find one channel, however all the others that I checked had a "Where to watch" button. Tap on that and every one said "There are no streaming services currently available..." What a waste of time.

Amazing app rendered useless now since May. Main issues are casting is broken as well as features. App no longer casts media as it should. Sometimes it will, most times it won't. Auto skip intros and credits 100% broken and no longer work at all. Quick play queues gone, among many other things. Even after the July update. I urge people to revert to the April version of the app and turn off auto updates.

What even happened?! I'd give it zero if I could. It was a solid five before May. The new app removed all the features worth having for some reason. They used to have a button for "Download Next X Unwatched Episodes" and then it would keep X number downloaded as you watched the show. That's gone and replaced with "Download the entire season". They don't even remove the watched episodes automatically like before. They split the music and audiobooks into its own equally bad app as well.

The new app is garbage and removed everything that I liked and found useful for casting to my TV. The ability to change video and audio quality on a casted video? Gone. Ability to change the subtitles on a casted video? Gone. Ability to put your favorite shows in a play list and then cast that playlist on shuffle? Gone. I am looking into rolling back my app so that it can be useful again.

Overall works great with a few annoyances. When you go to movies or TV menus, it defaults to "recommend" instead of your default library view. It will recommend things you have already watched in Plex and are marked as watched. Totally useless feature. Flip a coin if searching and selecting subtitles will work on the app when it works fine via browser.

I've loved it before (5üåü), but lately, every time they drop a new version lately, it causes issues. The most recent version (of Desktop Server) drops my remote access constantly, which makes the app useless. Yes, I know that's the desktop program and not the app, but what good is the app without the server access. PLEX LiveTV?!? I can use Pluto or Hulu for that. No, the purpose of the app is to connect to the server.

I literally can't stream my own media on my own drives over my home network. 1080p, 4k, doesn't matter. I spent the last week getting everything set up hoping I could use something as "simple" as plex to watch my media from all my devices. it doesn't work at all. On the server dashboard it will show media is being played, with seconds counting down, while the device has been stuck "buffering" for 10 minutes.

The app has been completely ruined with this new iteration. It does look really good but functionality wise, downloads are unusable with constant errors and video files being corrupted. You used to be able to download seasons, but now you can only download episodes one by one which is frustrating. I mainly use the download feature because I'm usually in places where I cannot use the Internet. Now I'm stuck downloading things to my phone and using VLC instead. Please fix this.

The Downloads Feature will Not Work and I cannot find support. I have purchased the life time plex pass and generally speaking, when I stream content it is very good. I only run into issues when trying to download content to prepare for offline situations. This is a must have feature but I cannot seem to get it to work. The downloads fail immediately when I try them. Plex offers no direct technical support other than a forum which is very frustrating when your issue is not shown.

They changed the app around and now things are broken. I am not a fan of the massive shift in design, but I could probably forgive that if it still functioned properly. I can watch a movie, but when I try to cast the movie it won't let me actually play it. Same deal on my wife's phone (she has iphone and I have Android). Hopefully this gets resolved, as I've had Plex for years and am a lifetime Plex Pass subscriber.

WOW, am I ever tired of the ads! Every time I have to leave the app to send a text or anything, I come back and am IMMEDIATELY given an ad that's minimum of 150 seconds. Every time. Doesn't matter if I just had a 150 second ad, if I leave the app a minute later, when I come back, I'm given another 150 second ad. And sometimes it restarts my episode when I open the app again.

For years I've relied on plex as an amazing platform for streaming. With the new update, it won't load ANYTHING because of my poor internet connection. It appears to be a bug or something where it's stuck on converting all videos to 1080p and I can't modify this to be automatic or "480p" per my terrible internet when I Chromecast. Plainly put, it functioned as the old app, and now it doesn't at all. This new update is terrible and it needs to be reverted back ASAP

The new app is terrible. They put a nice new skin on it, but it barely functions. constantly disconnecting from the server. stops midstream frequently for who knows what reason. can't download files without half of them breaking. I defended them when they upped their prices. hell I even doubled down and bought the lifetime subscription and I couldn't be more dissatisfied

As of the most recent update, I can no longer find any options for managing invites to my server or manage which libraries others have access to and have to use an entirely separate application (that also isn't very good) to see what activity is happening in with my server. What prompted such a backwards decision I couldn't possibly fathom.

Used to be pretty great. latest update seems to have completely broken downloads to phone. spent an entire day wrestling with "failed to download" and "re add to queue". finally the app claimed everything was downloaded, but now all my downloaded files are completely booked. playback is corrupted and skips all around. clearly something is wrong here.

I've been pretty happy with Plex overall over the years (lifetime subscription). I'm very disappointed in the new update/layout of Plex. I really dislike that I now have to have two separate apps for photos and music now, so three Plex apps total. No way to add movies to a playlist. Definitely a big step backwards.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback with us. It helps us to continue to improve our products.

scraped_reviews.content: I feel the need to update my review. the newest "Plex experience" on mobile is terrible for the features I use. Downloads were very hard to find, then when I did find them they were just a list of files. no way to see where you've left off, which you've already watched and it no longer syncs with the server when you're back online. after a month of struggling I had to download an older version and sideload it just to get back to the old experience.

Great service, but mobile downloads are terrible. They won't even work half the time, and now with the new update, it will still sometimes work, but now sometimes it looks like a download finished, but when you go to play it, it gives a vague error. Absolutely unacceptable. I have a better customer experience using handbrake and transcoding videos to put on my phone.

This app is fine and did everything I expected it to do but I've finally ditched Plex and I now use free open sourced Jellyfin instead. No more unwanted feature bloat, no more ads, no more limited customization, and most importantly (to me), Jellyfin doesn't report everything I watch back to "the mothership" so they can sell my data to third parties. Plex started out great but over the years it's gotten more and more like Google. It was fun while it lasted but I won't be coming back.

Ever since the new app interface update, sometime around may. I have been unable to use subtitles while casting from the app.Amongst a handful of other issues. The old layout was definitely more functional than the current GUI. Not to mention the app unlock fee that I had paid that just disappeared during the subscription model update. Honour the terms of the original transaction, or refund the app unlock fees.

New update is... different. Which i can excuse. But chromecast streaming is broken. Doesn't work 95% of the time. (Works fine for other apps and occasionally works for Plex so it isn't a network issue. But I want to watch something... not spend hours restarting devices hoping it randonly works again.) Downgraded to 10.26.0.2578 and problems went away.

This used to be a great app, but recently they completely ruined it. basic functionality it used to have, like uploading subtitles from my device, are now gone. the UI is way less intuitive. why do companies with great apps never leave well enough alone and have to tinker until they ruin it? I have been a happy Plex user for about 10 years but I'm going to seriously look into jellyfin now that Plex is abandoning its users and original purpose.

I like the new look. It's very funky and cool. But it's got a few problems. I wish it wouldn't overwrite my chosen fanart/BGs, and it really needs to show the metadata descriptions for audio & subtitle tracks in videos. The previous version and UX displayed these track descriptions. Now you're literally selecting audio and subtitles using trial and error.

dogwater. it used to be great but now it doesn't load my content, crashed when I try to download things, and constantly has errors that occur and break the whole app. I have no idea why they decided to take away an app that worked perfectly fine and replace it with one that doesn't work at all

I used to be be able to play my local home videos. Then, suddently, nothing will play anymore on my tablet. I did configure my home server to disable transcoding, because there is no reason to transcode video on a LAN anymore. But it just says "Unable to play media", while the Web player started to complain that the server is unable to do transcoding.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We‚Äôre sorry to hear that you are having trouble with Plex. If you still have issues, please post specific details in our support forums at https://forums.plex.tv/ if you haven't done so already. Our staff or friendly community should be able to help you out.
